result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Vernnell Quincy Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Vernnell Quincy Hamilton.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Defense still in need of discovery. Defense requests an additional status date. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Vernnell Quincy Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Vernnell Quincy Hamilton.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for a status conference. Defense received discovery, but cannot access it due to technology issues. Discussion held. Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Vernnell Quincy Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Vernnell Quincy Hamilton in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Vernnell Quincy Hamilton in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Vernnell Quincy Hamilton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
